edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1

Class NodeHeap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.prog_assgmnt_1.NodeHeap<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Desired Data Type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Heap<V>

    public class NodeHeap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Heap<V>
    Class: NodeHeap. A NodeHeap is a heap implementation that uses nodes instead of the more commonly used array data structure. This implementation is intuitive because it connects each node in the same way that one would visualize a heap to look like. It is interesting because each node in the heap can be mapped to using binary...
    Author:
    Khamille A. Sarmiento

      • elemCount

        public int elemCount
        Private Variable: elemCount. Type: int. Initially set to zero. Holds the number of elements in this heap.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeHeap

        public NodeHeap(Heap.MODE mode)
        Constructor for NodeHeap. When a new NodeHeap is created, it is empty and it's root is set to null. It's element count is also 0.
        Parameters:
        mode - Allows the user to set the heap to be MAX or MIN.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(V value)
        Public Method: add. Adds a new element into the next available spot in the heap. After the element is added, it is moved to its correct location on the heap to preserve either it's MAX or MIN heap property.
        Specified by:
        add in interface Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
        Parameters:
        value - Allows the user to determine the value of the new element.

      • remove

        public V remove()
        Public Method: remove. Removes the top element of the heap and returns the value of the element that was removed. if MAX: The largest element in the heap will be removed. if MIN: The smallest element in the heap will be removed.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
        Returns:
        The value of the element that was removed.

      • toArray

        public V[] toArray()
        Public Method: toArray. Copies the values of each node from the heap into a generic array.
        Specified by:
        toArray in interface Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
        Returns:
        The heap as an Object array.

      • fromArray

        public void fromArray(V[] array)
        Public Method: fromArray. Takes a generic array and places its elements into a heap that follows the heap property, specified by its mode.
        Specified by:
        fromArray in interface Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
        Parameters:
        array - A generic array with elements to add to the heap.

      • heapify

        public void heapify()
        Public Method: heapify. Takes the current heap and rearranges its nodes to follow the heap property, which is specified by it's mode.

      • getSortedContents

        public V[] getSortedContents()
        Public Method: getSortedContents. Sorts the values of the heap from greatest to least if MAX heap, or from least to greatest if MIN heap. Returns a generic array that contains values of the heap, sorted according to the heap's specified mode. if MAX: The array will contain values sorted from greatest to least. if MIN: The array will contain values sorted from least to greatest.
        Specified by:
        getSortedContents in interface Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
        Returns:
        The generic array whose contents are sorted in descending order if MAX, or ascending order if MIN.

      • getMode

        public Heap.MODE getMode()
        Public Method: getMode. Returns the mode of the heap, whether it be a MAX heap or a MIN heap.
        Specified by:
        getMode in interface Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
        Returns:
        Mode of the heap.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(Heap.MODE mode)
        Public Method: setMode. Allows the user to change the mode of the heap to be either a MAX heap or a MIN heap.
        Specified by:
        setMode in interface Heap<V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>>
        Parameters:
        mode - The desired heap mode. Can only be one of two things: MAX, MIN.
